properties.entry: Import data from CSV/TSV, spreadsheets or probsoln.sty files, or select data from an SQL database
Create a new database from a template
Replace cell contents with null value
Replace all empty cells with null value
Replace all null cells with empty value
Insert a new column after the current column
Insert a new column before the current column
Set all cells in current column to null
Edit header details for current column
Move current column to the left
Move current column to the right
Edit the name of the current database (not related to the file name)
Insert a new row after the current row
Insert a new row before the current row
Set all cells in current row to null
Replace cell contents with null value
Add new column after the last column
Add new row after the last row

Convert empty elements to null (probsoln and spreadsheets only)
Strip solution environment from probsoln problems
These options are only applicable to CSV/TSV files, not to spreadsheets or SQL imports.
These options are applicable to all non-TeX imported sources (CSV/TSV, spreadsheets and SQL queries).
These options are applicable to CSV/TSV files and spreadsheets.
If set, characters outside of quotes will be ignored
Number of lines to skip at the start:
Delimiter doubled if occurring in cell content
Delimiter and backslash escaped with backslash
Number of lines to skip at the start:
If set, characters outside of quotes will be ignored
If you add new currencies here, remember to also add them in your document using \DTLnewcurrencysymbol if you need datatool.sty to parse currency values in the document.
Preferred dimension on startup. The cell editor may be wider than the preferred width in order to fit the toolbar.
% This is a comment The \emph'{'quick'}' brown ``fox'''' jumped over the \strong'{'lazy'}' dog. \$ £ € \# [ + - ] 0123456789 @ / < > \& ~ $x_0 y^2$ ‘quoted’ “double quoted” ! ?
Show datum information in numeric cells
Application needs a restart for a change in look and feel and button size to take effect.
Language for the application help pages
Application needs to be restarted for manual and GUI language change to take effect.
Perl and the Perl Tk module must be installed for plugins to work. If you have Perl installed but it''s not on your path, you need to specify the full path to the Perl executable in the box below.
Default format to use when saving new or imported data
When saving as DBTEX 3.0, save datum elements for:
Strip solution environment from probsoln problems
For other import settings, go to the {0} tab.
Text (LaTeX syntax with default category codes):
Text is not numeric. Check the parser settings if this is incorrect.
Parse the text for a numeric value (integer, decimal or currency)
Reloads the cell content into the editor
Replace cell contents with null value
Copy contents of text area to the clipboard
Discard the edits you have just made?
''{0}'' has been modified. Do you want to save it?
Double-click on the cell to edit it.
Double-click on the column title to edit the header information or single-click and drag sideways to move the column.
Double-click on the tab to edit the database name. Click on the tab close icon to close this database.
Use {0} to add columns to the database.
Drag row button vertically to move it up or down.
Use {0} to add rows to the database.
Use {0} and {1} to add or remove columns and rows, or double-click on a cell to edit it.
Double-click on the cell to view or edit its contents.
{0} <character> Delimiter used in CSV files. (Defaults to ''{1}''. Synonym: {2})
{0} <setting> Set behaviour for empty rows on import from CSV or spreadsheet. (Default value: {1})
{0} <setting> Set behaviour for parsing special characters within elements in CSV files. (Default value: {1})
{0} CSV files have a header row.{1} Synonym: {2}.
{0} CSV files don''t have a header row.{1} Synonym: {2}.
{0} Don''t ignore characters that haven''t been enclosed in the designated delimiters.
{0} <character> Separator used in CSV files. (Defaults to ''{1}''. Synonym: {2})
{0} <number> Skip the specified <number> of lines at the start of CSV files.
{0} Ignore characters not enclosed in the designated delimiters.
{0} <mode> Set debug mode for TeX Parser Library.

{0} <key> <operator> <value> Add a filter (may be used multiple times). <key> is the name of a column label and <operator> may be one of: ''eq'' (equals), ''ne'' (does not equal), ''le'' (is less than or equal to), ''lt'' (is less than), ''ge'' (is greater than or equal to), ''gt'' (is greater than), ''regex'' (matches the regular expression).
{0} When filtering discard rows that don''t match the filter specifications (and keep those that do match). (Default.)
{0} (or {1}) Print this help message and exit.
{0} (or {1}) <datatool file> Load <datatool file>. (Can''t be used with --csv or --sql or --probsoln.) The {0} (or {1}) switch is optional so {2} <file> is equivalent to {2} {0} <file>.
{0} <log file> Write messages to log file
{0} <filename> If debugging on, log TeX Parser messages in the given file.
{0} <key> <file> Merge input or imported database with the database stored in the given file on the column whose label is <key>. (Only one of the merge options is permitted.)
{0} <key> <file> Merge input or imported database with data imported from given file on the column whose label is <key>. (Only one of the merge options is permitted.)
{0} <key> <file> Import CSV data from <file> and merge with the loaded database on the column whose label is <key>. (Only one of the merge options is permitted.)
{0} <key> <filename> Import ODS data from <filename> and merge with the loaded database on the column whose label is <key>. (Only one of the merge options is permitted.)
{0} <key> <file> Import probsoln data from <file> and merge with the loaded database on the column whose label is <key>. (Only one of the merge options is permitted.)
{0} <key> <statement> Import data from SQL database and merge with the loaded database on the column whose label is <key>. (Only one of the merge options is permitted.)
{0} <key> <filename> Import Excel data from <filename> and merge with the loaded database on the column whose label is <key>. (Only one of the merge options is permitted.)
{0} <name> Set the database label (as used in \DTLnewdb) to <name>.
{0} Don''t change file permissions for .dbtex files. {1}
{0} Don''t skip empty rows on import.{1}
{0} Set file permissions to owner read/write on .dbtex files. {1}
{0} If the TeX parser encounters \begin'{'document'}', stop parsing
{0} <col-1>,...,<col-n> Remove all columns except those identified (labels or indexes starting from 1).
{0} <col-1>,...,<col-n> Remove given list of columns (labels or indexes starting from 1).
{0} <number> Set the random seed to <number> or clear it if <number> is "".
{0} <ref> Fetch data from sheet <ref>, where <ref> can be an index (starting from 0) or the name of a sheet.
{0} Shuffle the database. (Shuffle is always performed after sort, regardless of the option order.)
{0} Skip empty rows on import from CSV or spreadsheet.{1}

{0} [+|-]<field> Sort the database on the column whose label is given by <field>. If <field> is preceded by ''+'', use ascending order. If <field> is preceded by ''-'', use descending order. If sign prefix is omitted, ''+'' is assumed. (Sort is always performed before shuffle, regardless of option order.)
{0} Use case insensitive comparison when sorting strings. (Default.)
{0} Use case sensitive comparison when sorting strings.
{0} <tag> Sort according to the alphabet identified by <tag> (which should be a valid IETF language tag) or, if <tag> is the keyword ''none'' use non-locale letter order.
{0} <statement> Import data from SQL database where <statement> is a SQL SELECT statement.

{0} <action> When requesting a SQL password in batch mode if there is no console available do: <action>: ''stdin'' - read from STDIN instead (least secure option) <action>: ''gui'' - use a dialog box (default) <action>: ''error'' - issue an error.
{0} Don''t wipe the password from memory as soon as it has been used to connect to a SQL database.{1}
{0} <password> SQL password (insecure). If omitted, you will be prompted for the password if you try to import data from a SQL database.
{0} For extra security, wipe the password from memory as soon as it has been used to connect to a SQL database.{1}

{0} <n> Truncate the database to the first <n> rows. (Has no effect if <n> is greater than the total number of rows.) This option is always performed last (after any sorting, shuffling and filtering).
Ignoring filter option ''{0}''. No such column label.

This file was not in the expected .dbtex or .dtltex format, so the TeX Parser Library was used to interpret it. If you save a database to this file, the data will be saved in the .dbtex or .dtltex format not it its current format. Please check that you haven''t accidentally loaded your LaTeX document.
Verbatim text has been detected. You must remove this before inputting the database into a LaTeX document. See https://texfaq.org/FAQ-verbwithin for more details.
Verbatim text has been detected in cell ({0,number},{1,number}). You must remove this before inputting the database into a LaTeX document. See https://texfaq.org/FAQ-verbwithin for more details.
Quick load failed ({0}). Trying again with TeX Parser Library.
<datatool file> can''t be used with an import option
Delimiter must be a single character not a string
End index {0,number} must be less than starting index {1,number}
CSV escape must be a single character not a string
Invalid or unknown IETF locale tag ''{0}''
Separator must be a single character not a string
Invalid CSV skip lines value {0} (must be a non-negative number)
Password expected after {0} (omit {0} to be prompted for a password)
Sort field (and optionally ''+'' or ''-'' prefix) expected after {0}
IETF locale tag or ''none'' expected after {0}
Option conflict: can''t specify both {0} and {1}
Unable to find plugin dictionary for locale ''{0}'' or fallback ''{1}''
I''m sorry, the delimiter ''{0}'' is currently not supported by the CSV library. The character code must be less than {1}.
I''m sorry, the escape character ''{0}'' is currently not supported by the CSV library. The character code must be less than {1}.
I''m sorry, the separator ''{0}'' is currently not supported by the CSV library. The character code must be less than {1}.
{0} or {1} required for batch mode. (If you want the GUI interface, use the {2} option. See {3} for help.)
{0} or {1} required for batch mode. (Use {2} for help.)
A database must either be loaded or imported when using batch mode. (If you want the GUI interface, use the {0} option. See {1} for help.)
A database must either be loaded or imported. (Use {0} for help.)
Premature end of file. Not a DBTEX v2.0 file. Failed to find ''{0}''
column {0,number} ended with closing tag for column {1,number}
row {0,number} ended with closing tag for row {1,number}
Field ''{0}'' not permitted in its own fallback list.
(Internal Error) Something's gone wrong. Failed to import data
You can''t set the type to ''{0}'': row {1,number} is of type ''{2}''.
Invalid name ''{0}'' (can''t be empty or contain TeX special characters)
No such file ''{0}''. If you want to import SQL data, use {1} instead
You have opted for a custom start up directory, but you haven't specified a directory
''{0}'' is not a decimal type. (Change the ''{1}'' selector.)
File: {0} Extension ''{1}'' is forbidden for output files
File: {0} Extension ''{1}'' is forbidden for log files
You need to specify the path to the perl executable to run a plugin
Process ''{0}'' (running in ''{1}'') failed with exit code {2,number}
